result.execSummary:
Shane A Smithey was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Shane A Smithey was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane A Smithey

records.addlTxt: 03:11 PM Defendant Shane A Smithey in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Shane A Smithey in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 22CF58. State believes it will be a waiver. Halyburton agrees and has provided the court with a waiver of PH form. Court goes over the form, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Halyburton has Information, will proceed to ARGN, waives further reading and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas, will have set for JT, notes bond is $1000 cash and asks if she would like to be heard on bond. Halyburton believes there will be a speedy resolution and would like bond to remain at this time. Court now calls 22CF54. Halyburton indicates Smithey is waiving his right to extradition hearing, he is the same individual as listed in the warrant from Indiana, has advised him of his rights, is not seeking governors warrant and waiving the right to Habeas Corpus. Court goes over the extradition form and signs in court.
Extradition hearing on April 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:44 AM Defendant Shane A Smithey in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Shane A Smithey in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Halyburton has gone over the extradition paperwork and Court has that paperwork. Court - not going to proceed on the extradition hearing until after the PH is held for stated reasons. Discussion as it relates to if Indiana is coming to get him, hold off on extradition at this point. Court will set this matter for an Extradition Hearing on 4/25/22 at 3:30 PM.  Extradition hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: from defendant regarding extradition. Sent to JA for possible scheduling.

ADDRESS INFO for Shane A Smithey
Current: 1660 Superior Street, Three Lakes, WI 54562 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2022)
Prior: 2514 W Franklin Street, Evansville, IN 47712 United States
Extradition hearing on April 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.

03:43 PM Defendant Shane A Smithey appears by video from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF58 and 22CF54. On 22CF58 here for INIT - Smithey has received a copy of criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Smithey understands. Court advises of right to an attorney. Smithey would like an attorney. Court refers to SPD, if not eligible for SPD then would have to private hire or apply for court appointed attorney. Bond has been set and will be continued. AIA set for 4/13 at 11:30 AM. 22CF54 - Court explains extradition process, fugitive from IN, warrant issued out of Vanderburg, IN. Smithey is aware of those charges, but was not aware of the warrant, believes he is the defendant named in the warrant. Court today was determine he is waiving extradition or to wait for issuance of governor's warrant. Court advises of right to an attorney, explains governor's warrant process. Smithey understands and like to have an attorney. Court refers to SPD. Smithey asks if there is a bond in this case. State asks for $1000 cash bond. Court will impose $1000 cash bond and schedules for extradition hearing on 4/27/22 at 10:45 AM.
Extradition hearing on March 30, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
